results.title: Call of the wild
results.creator_credit: Peter Svatek, Julie Allan, Pieter Kroonenburg, Kingsborough Greenlight Pictures, Fries/Schultz Film Group and Hallmark Entertainment
results.brief_description: Based on Jack London’s classic novel about an Alaskan gold prospector and the dog he saves from a brutal life of slavery as a sled dog in Canada’s vast frozen Yukon territory. This French/Canadian co-production has been hailed as one of the most accurate dramatic presentations of London’s work. Cast includes Rutger Hauer, Burke Lawrence, Charles Powell, Bronwen Booth and Richard Dreyfuss
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Svatek, Julie Allan, Pieter Kroonenburg, Kingsborough Greenlight Pictures, Fries/Schultz Film Group and Hallmark Entertainment

results.title: The Shooting (S)
results.creator_credit: Monte Hellman, Jack Nicholson and Santa Clara Productions
results.brief_description: A group of bounty hunters make camp in a bleak desert. Returning to camp Willett (Warren Oates) finds out his brother has gotten drunk in town and run down a little boy. Additionally his brother’s partner has gotten shot in the back by an unknown gunman. Coley (Will Hutchins), fearful of what is going on gives Willett his guns. The next day, the two meet a mysterious woman (Millie Perkins) who offers Willett $1,000 to take her to the town of Kingsley. Although this film is relatively unknown, it is attracting a small but strong cult following, and is attracting more reviews each year.

results.title: Restoration
results.creator_credit: Michael Hoffman, Sarah Ryan Black, Andy Paterson, Cary Brokaw and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: Restoration is a lavish costume drama which follows the story of Robert Merivel (Robert Downey Jr.)a young doctor whose life is changed when he is favoured by King Charles II (Sam Neill). Amidst the decadent opulance of the Restoration court Merivel soon loses sight of his career as a doctor but when he is abandoned by Charles he must return to poverty and find a place in the real world again. Based on the novel by Rose Tremain, Michael Hoffman’s film gives a great sense of life in England during the Restoration period. Sam Neill is excellent as the capricious King and Robert Downey Jr. likeable as the wayward Merivel. With appearances by Meg Ryan, Hugh Grant, Polly Walker, David Thewlis and Ian Mackellan and gorgeous music by Henry Purcell. Winner of 1996 Academy Awards for best Art Direction and Best Costume Design.

results.title: Hercules returns
results.creator_credit: David Parker, Philip Jaroslow and Philm Productions
results.brief_description: After resigning from their jobs, 2 film company executives (David Argue and Bruce Spence) open a revival theatre. On their grand opening they plan to screen the Italian epic, “Hercules”, the film that closed the theatre down. Their ex-boss exacts revenge by sending them the wrong print; an Italian one with no subtitles. With little or no means for rectifying the situation, they make do with what they have at hand and dub the voices themselves. What eventuates is a dramatic departure from the original version, which becomes set in Climidia, with Hercules a cabaret singer and a supporting cast that includes Labia, Testiculi and Machismo. Developed from the live show, “Double take meets Hercules”, written and directed by Des Mangan. Cast includes David Argue, Bruce Spence, Mary Coustas and Michael Carman.

results.title: The Nightmare before Christmas
results.creator_credit: Henry Selick, Tim Burton, Denise Di Novi and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: This delightfully different animated fantasy opens the door to an intriguing new world - where extraordinary surprises and captivating music await. Journey on an incredible adventure of fantastic sights and sounds with the whimsical characters, Pumpkin Jack, Jack Skellington, and the rag doll, Sally. One day Jack discovers Christmastown - a glittering glory of bright lights and shiny packages. Charmed by its magic, Jack brings back this newfound holiday to his ghoulish friends, triggering an hilarious turn of events. Told through the innovative technique of stop-motion animation is an unparalleled adventure that dazzles the eye and charms the mind. Cast includes Danny Elfman, Chris Sarandon, Catherine O’Hara, William Hickey, Glenn Shadix.

results.title: Albino alligator
results.creator_credit: Kevin Spacey, Brad Jenkel, Steve Stabler, Brad Krevoy and Motion Picture Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Kevin Spacey makes his directorial debut with “Albino alligator”, a tense and claustrophobic thriller. A robbery goes wrong for three petty crims (Gary Sinise, Matt Dillon, William Fichtner), when a shootout results in the death of a federal agent. They flee to Dino’s Last Chance Bar, a New Orleans basement dive. Their attempt to lay low and maintain anonymity is abruptly shattered when government agents, camera crews and a SWAT team surround the building. The stalemate causes the crooks, patrons and bar employees to react to the situation in unexpected and dramatic ways, contributing to the films tense drama. Also starring Faye Dunaway, Skeet Ulrich, M. Emmet Walsh and Joe Mantegna.

results.title: The Colditz story
results.creator_credit: Guy Hamilton, Ivan Foxwell and British Lion Films
results.brief_description: The Germans believed that no man could escape form Colditz Castle, set as it was in the heart of the Reich, 400 miles from any neutral frontier. This film tells the story of how the British, French, Dutch and Polish prisoners of war who were incarcerated in Colditz set out to prove their captors wrong. Starring John Mills and Eric Portman. Based on the novel “The Colditz story” by P.R. Reid.

results.title: Cross of iron
results.creator_credit: Sam Peckinpah, Arlene Sellers, Alex Winitsky and Rapid Film GmbH
results.brief_description: 1943 : the German Army is retreating, pounded on all sides by the Russian onslaught. The only men who survive are those who revel in war and destruction. Men like Sargeant Steiner (James Coburn). And men who won’t risk their necks for anything. Men like Captain Stransky (Maximilian Schell). Stransky is new to the ugliness of front-line battles, but determined to win himself some glory before he returns home. The one thing he wants above all is the supreme symbol of bravery - the Iron Cross. And he wants Steiner to win it for him - and get blown apart while doing so. Stranky’s determination to obtain that coveted emblem of bravery at whatever cost is the background to Sam Peckinpah’s gripping story of men living at extremes and fighting for their lives. Based on the novel by Willi Heinrich.

results.title: The Merchant of four seasons
results.brief_description: Set in the 1950s this film is based directly on a memory from Fassbinder’s youth. An uncle trying to reenter civilian life after serving in the German army set up in business as a fruit and vegetable vendor, other members of the family not only failed to support him but seemed deliberately to put obstacles in his path. Fassbinder turned this recollection of domestic discord into an unsparing critique of selfishness, snobbery and ad inhumanity in a ‘typical’ German middle-class family.

results.title: Ace Ventura: when nature calls (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Steve Oedekerk, James G. Robinson and Morgan Creek
results.brief_description: Jim Carrey again stars as Ace Ventura, the animal sleuth with the gravity-defying hairstyle in this sequel to ‘Ace Ventura, Pet Detective’ (309280). In the deepest jungles of Africa, two tribes will fight a savage war unless their sacred animal god is found. So they’re sending for the only man who can help. Africa will never be the same again as Ace discovers the animal within and answers the call of the wild in this out-there comedy! Cast includes Jim Carrey, Ian McNeice, Simon Callow, Adewale Akinnuoye-Agbaje and Maynard Eziashi.
